message.name: A9
message.say: Jordan, can you answer this question?

message.name: A10
message.say: Having trouble deciding? Let me choose one for you.

message.name: A18
message.say: I'm sorry, that is not correct.

message.name: A25
message.say: We are going to try a bit of trivia to review the skills we have learned.

message.name: A26
message.say: Each category has 4 questions with point values of 100, 200, 300, and 400. The 400 point questions are the most difficult.

message.name: A27
message.say: You will go back to the main page to pick your next question. After correct answers, the score bar at the top will fill with the amount of points that the question was worth.

message.name: A28
message.say: Choose a question by clicking on one of the numbers below a category.

message.name: A29
message.say: A question will appear. You can answer a question by clicking on the answer buttons.

message.name: A30
message.say: When you completely fill the bar, you have completed the activity.

message.name: A31
message.say: Questions that you answer correctly will turn green.

message.name: A32
message.say: You see that there are four categories for the questions.

message.name: A33
message.say: Text signals, writer's purpose, using clues, and mixed review.

message.name: A34
message.say: Wow! It looks like you got all the points needed to finish this lesson.

message.name: A35
message.say: and Jordan great job with this activity.

message.name: A36
message.say: I'm glad you seem to have learned so much using this program.

message.name: A37
message.say: If you answer incorrectly, you will see a red border around the question. You are able to click those questions to try again.

message.name: A39
message.say: What type of text signal is displayed in the box below? Click your answer

message.name: A40
message.say: The text signal in the graphic is a visual cue.

message.name: A41
message.say: The text signal in the box is a visual cue. A visual cue is a picture, graph, or image which can help us to understand what we are reading.

message.name: A45
message.say: What type of text signal is displayed in the box below? Click your answer

message.name: A46
message.say: The text signal in the graphic is a visual cue.

message.name: A47
message.say: The text signal in the box is a visual cue. A visual cue is a picture, graph, or image which can help us to understand what we are reading.

message.name: A51
message.say: What does the acronym DMV mean in this sentence? I have to stop by the DMV to renew my driver's license.

message.name: A52
message.say: The acronym DMV means Department of Motor Vehicles.

message.name: A53
message.say: The acronym DMV means Department of Motor Vehicles. The context clue "drivers' license" in the sentence helps us to choose the correct meaning of DMV.

message.name: A57
message.say: What does the acronym DMV mean in this sentence? I have to stop by the DMV to renew my driver's license.

message.name: A58
message.say: The acronym DMV means Department of Motor Vehicles.

message.name: A59
message.say: The acronym DMV means Department of Motor Vehicles. The context clue "drivers' license" in the sentence helps us to choose the correct meaning of DMV.

message.name: A63
message.say: What is the meaning of present in this sentence? Danielle brought a present to the party.

message.name: A64
message.say: The word present in this sentence means a gift.

message.name: A65
message.say: The word present in this sentence means a gift. The context clue "party" in the sentence helps us to understand that present means a gift.

message.name: A69
message.say: What is the meaning of present in this sentence? Danielle brought a present to the party.

message.name: A70
message.say: The word present in this sentence means a gift.

message.name: A71
message.say: The word present in this sentence means a gift. The context clue "party" in the sentence helps us to understand that present means a gift.

message.name: A75
message.say: What word in the sentence below helps us to define the word manongguhheeluh? Many people think that the manongguhheeluh is the most beautiful river in Pittsburgh.

message.name: A76
message.say: The word that helps to define manongguhheeluh is the word river.

message.name: A77
message.say: The word that helps to define manongguhheeluh is the word river. When we replace manongguhheeluh with each one of the answer words, the word river makes the most sense.

message.name: A82

message.name: A83
message.say: The word that helps to define manongguhheeluh is the word river. When we replace manongguhheeluh with each one of the answer words, the word river makes the most sense.

message.name: A87
message.say: Choose what the writer is expressing with this punctuation in the sentence below. Carol's son asked her, Can I invite my friends over when I finish my homework.

message.name: A88
message.say: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question.

message.name: A89
message.say: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question. The writer uses the question mark to show that Carol's son is asking to invite his friends over.

message.name: A93
message.say: Choose what the writer is expressing with this punctuation in the sentence below. Carol's son asked her, Can I invite my friends over when I finish my homework.

message.name: A94
message.say: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question.

message.name: A95
message.say: The punctuation mark says that the writer is asking a question. The writer uses the question mark to show that Carol's son is asking to invite his friends over.

message.name: A99
message.say: What is the metaphor in this sentence? At her banking job Celeste is a machine, but when she gets home she crashes.

message.name: A100
message.say: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine.

message.name: A101
message.say: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine. The metaphor means that Celeste works very hard the same way that a computer works very hard and makes no mistakes.

message.name: A105
message.say: What is the metaphor in this sentence? At her banking job Celeste is a machine, but when she gets home she crashes.

message.name: A106
message.say: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine.

message.name: A107
message.say: The metaphor in the sentence is Celeste is a machine. The metaphor means that Celeste works very hard the same way that a computer works very hard and makes no mistakes.

message.name: A111
message.say: What clarifying question helps us understand the word bear in the sentence below? While fixing her deck, Dominique learns that the beams she is using must be able to bear up to 200 pounds.

message.name: A112
message.say: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word.

message.name: A113
message.say: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word. Bear can mean a large animal, but here the word bear means hold. As in, "she has to make sure the beams she is using can hold up to 200 pounds."

message.name: A117
message.say: What clarifying question helps us understand the word bear in the sentence below? While fixing her deck, Dominique learns that the beams she is using must be able to bear up to 200 pounds.

message.name: A118
message.say: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word.

message.name: A119
message.say: The clarifying question that Dominique should ask is what are the two or more definitions for this word. Bear can mean a large animal, but here the word bear means hold. As in, "she has to make sure the beams she is using can hold up to 200 pounds."

message.name: A123
message.say: In the sentence below, a simile is being used to compare which two things? After a cold afternoon building a snow man, Mawreese's hands were like icicles.

message.name: A124
message.say: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles.

message.name: A125
message.say: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles. The simile in the sentence is "Mawreese's hands were like icicles" where the word like compares hands and icicles.

message.name: A129
message.say: In the sentence below, a simile is being used to compare which two things? After a cold afternoon building a snow man, Mawreese's hands were like icicles.

message.name: A130
message.say: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles.

message.name: A131
message.say: The two things being compared with a simile are hands and icicles. The simile in the sentence is "Mawreese's hands were like icicles" where the word, like, compares hands and icicles.

message.name: A135
message.say: Fill in the blank. The italics, colors, and text size in this text are examples of what?

message.name: A136
message.say: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues.

message.name: A137
message.say: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues. In print cues, the text itself is altered by things like red letters, underlining, and large print to highlight information.

message.name: A141
message.say: Fill in the blank. The italics, colors, and text size in this text are examples of what?

message.name: A142
message.say: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues.

message.name: A143
message.say: The italics, colors, and text size are examples of print cues. In print cues, the text itself is altered by things like red letters, underlining, and large print to highlight information.

message.name: A147
message.say: Based on the text signals, what kind of book do you think this is?

message.name: A148
message.say: Based on the text signals, this is a cookbook.

message.name: A149
message.say: Based on the text signals, this is a cookbook. The picture is of a donut, and the subtitle is gluten free vegan recipes from donuts to snickerdoodles.

message.name: A154
message.say: Based on the text signals, this is a cookbook.

message.name: A155
message.say: Based on the text signals, this is a cookbook. The picture is of a donut, and the subtitle is gluten free vegan recipes from donuts to snickerdoodles.

message.name: A159
message.say: Use the text signals to help determine which bus station is re-opened.

message.name: A160
message.say: The bus station that is now reopened is Pape Station.

message.name: A161
message.say: The bus station that is now reopened is Pape Station. Based on the text signals, we read both "Pape Station Reopened" and the sentence Pape Station is now open.

message.name: A171
message.say: Click the word below that has an affix.

message.name: A173
message.say: The affixed word below is friendliest. The suffix e-s-t indicates the most, so anyone described as the friendliest is the most friendly person.

message.name: A178
message.say: Ok, let's try this one again. Click the word below that has an affix.

message.name: A180
message.say: The affixed word below is friendliest. The suffix e-s-t indicates the most, so anyone described as the friendliest is the most friendly person.

message.name: A185
message.say: Click the word below that has an affix.

message.name: A187
message.say: The affixed word below is irrelevant. The i-r is a prefix that adds the meaning not or opposite of to a word. So, an irrelevant thing is not relevant.

message.name: A192
message.say: Let's try this one again. Click the word below that has an affix.

message.name: A194
message.say: The affixed word below is irrelevant. The i-r is a prefix that adds the meaning not or opposite of to a word. So, an irrelevant thing is not relevant.

message.name: A199
message.say: Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

message.name: A200
message.say: The root of the word displeasing is please.

message.name: A201
message.say: The root of the example word is please. The prefix d-i-s means not and the suffix i-n-g means it is currently happening. So, displeasing is something that is not pleasing right now.

message.name: A203
message.say: That is not the correct root.

message.name: A206
message.say: Let's try this one again. Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

message.name: A207
message.say: The root of the word displeasing is please.

message.name: A208
message.say: The root of the example word is please. The prefix d-i-s means not and the suffix i-n-g means it is currently happening. So, displeasing is something that is not pleasing right now.

message.name: A210
message.say: That is not the correct root.

message.name: A213
message.say: Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

message.name: A214
message.say: The root of this word is trepid.

message.name: A215
message.say: The root of the example word is trepid. The prefix in means not and the suffix i-n-g indicates that an action is being done a certain way. So, intrepidly means doing something without fear or hesitation.

message.name: A218
message.say: That is not the answer I was looking for.

message.name: A220
message.say: Alright, let's try again. Click the word below that is the root of the following example.

message.name: A221
message.say: The root of this word is trepid.

message.name: A222
message.say: The root of the example word is trepid. The prefix in means not and the suffix i-n-g indicates that an action is being done a certain way. So, intrepidly means doing something without fear or hesitation.

message.name: A227
message.say: Which of the following strategies is an example of using context clues?

message.name: A228
message.say: Reading the words around a confusing word is an example of using context clues.

message.name: A229
message.say: Reading the words around a confusing word is an example of using context clues. When you read the words around a confusing word it can help you to understand the meaning of the confusing word.

message.name: A233
message.say: Which of the following strategies is an example of using context clues?

message.name: A234
message.say: Reading the words around a confusing word is an example of using context clues.

message.name: A235
message.say: Reading the words around a confusing word is an example of using context clues. When you read the words around a confusing word it can help you to understand the meaning of the confusing word.
